main

Class UsersDB

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Users
      • main.UsersDB

  • public class UsersDB
extends Users
    This is the UsersDB class. This class is the child of Users. This class carries out the database functions defined in the Users class. It stores, gets, checks and creates users.
    See Also:
    Users, User

    • Method Detail

      • createUser

        public User createUser(java.lang.String username,
                       java.lang.String password)
                throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        This method is responsible for creating a new user. It retrieves the username and password input by the ControllerCreateUser class. It then inserts this information into the users database.
        Specified by:
        createUser in class Users
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException
        See Also:
        ControllerCreateUser

      • logIn

        public void logIn(java.lang.String username,
                  java.lang.String password)
           throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        This method logs the user into the system. Firstly it sends the session ID to the logOut method to hold so that the users session can be logged. Then it gets the user and checks if they are in the database table users. It then checks if the password entered for the user is valid. Finally it logs the user in. It works in tangent with ControllerLogIn.
        Specified by:
        logIn in class Users
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException
        See Also:
        ControllerLogIn

      • logOut

        public void logOut(int sessionID)
        It has the sessionID from the logged in user. It then fetches the the record where the id matches the stored id in the sessions table of the database. The session is then delete logging the user out. This works in tangent with the ControllerLogOut class.
        Specified by:
        logOut in class Users
        See Also:
        ControllerLogOut

      • isLoggedIn

        public boolean isLoggedIn(int sessionID)
        This method checks if the sessions ID is already logged in the database sessions table. If the session exists it returns true, else it returns false.
        Specified by:
        isLoggedIn in class Users

      • getSessionID

        public int getSessionID(java.lang.String username)
        This method retrieves the sessionID linked to the username currently logged in. It is used to log users out of the program by returning their sessionID linked to the username they logged in with.
        Specified by:
        getSessionID in class Users

      • getUser

        public User getUser(java.lang.String username)
             throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        This method is used to compare passwords when users attempt to log in. It retrieves the password stored in the users table of the database and compares it to the password entered by the user. This works in tangent with the ControllerLogIn class.
        Specified by:
        getUser in class Users
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException
        See Also:
        ControllerLogIn

      • getUser

        public User getUser(int sessionID)
             throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        This retrieves the username of the current session holder.
        Specified by:
        getUser in class Users
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException

      • checkUser

        public boolean checkUser(java.lang.String username)
        This method checks whether or not the user exists in the database. It is used in conjucntion with the ControllerCreateUser to check if the username is taken.
        Specified by:
        checkUser in class Users
        See Also:
        ControllerCreateUser

      • checkPrivellage

        public boolean checkPrivellage(java.lang.String username,
                               java.lang.String password)
                        throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        This method checks if the user is the administrator. If the user is the administrator it assigns them a session ID. This works with ControllerAdmin to send the administrator to the admin page.
        Specified by:
        checkPrivellage in class Users
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException
        See Also:
        ControllerAdmin

      • list

        public java.util.List<User> list()
                          throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                 javax.servlet.ServletException
        This method fetches all users from the users table in the database. It works with ControllerAdmin and ControllerCreateUser to allow an up-to-date list of taken usernames to be viewed when creating a user.
        Specified by:
        list in class Users
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException
        java.sql.SQLException
        See Also:
        ControllerAdmin, ControllerCreateUser
